materials: Plastic #1 (PETE); Plastic #2 (HDPE); Plastic #2 (Color HDPE); Plastic #3 (PVC); Plastic #4 (LDPE); Plastic #5 (Polypropylene); Plastic #6 (Polystyrene); Plastic #7; Aerosol Spray Cans; Aluminum Cans; Aluminum; Books (Reuse); Glass (Brown); Brown Paper Bags; Brush; Cardboard; Catalogs; Christmas Trees; Glass (Clear); Clothing; Computer (Reuse); Computer Paper; Computer (Recycling); Electronics; Gift Bags; Gift Boxes; Grass Clippings; Glass (Green); Greeting Cards; Household Goods; Large Household Appliances; Leaves; Magazines; Paper (Mixed); Newspapers; Ornaments; Wood Pallets; Paperboard; Phone books; Plastic Shopping Bags; Televisions; Tin or Steel Cans; Tree Trimmings; Used Tires; Weeds; Office Paper; Wood; Yard Waste; MP3 Players; Food Storage Bags
notes: Please place all papers, except cardboard, in the mixed paper bin.  Please rinse cans, bottles, jars, and containers clean.  Keep plastic bags clean and separate from other materials.  This program does not accept soiled paper, soiled cardboard, styrofoam, motor oil containers, chemical containers, broken glass, light bulbs, dishes, glasses, Pyrex, window glass, or auto glass.  Call for more information on computer and television disposal.  Residents with a Recycling Permit will be charged a fee to dispose of white goods, electronics, or wood.  There will be no charge for Landfill Permit holders.  Large branches and stumps are not accepted.
